#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Get Your Husband to Use Proper Table Manners
#Text=Perhaps a loud , guttural after dinner belch is an appropriate way to tell the cook you loved the meal in some cultures , but in most nations it s considered to be rude and pretty disgusting .

#Text=If you feel as if you ’ve been dining with a caveman since you said , “ I do ” and ca n’t take it anymore , there are ways to revise his uncivilized table manners and transform your beast into a prince .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Do n’t point out the obvious .
#Text=Barking orders at your spouse is only going to cultivate passive aggressive behavior .
#Text=While he may be acting like an animal , telling him could be humiliating .
#Text=Instead of whacking his elbows off the table or snapping his jaw closed when he chews , take a more subtle approach .
#Text=Ask him what kind of table manners were practiced at his house growing up .
#Text=Perhaps he ’s forgotten manners that his mother insisted upon and recalling them may bring them back today .
#Text=Point out bad manners on TV .
#Text=See a TV or movie character exhibiting the same bad manners as your man ?
#Text=Point out how garish the character ’s manners are -- maybe it ’ll ring a bell .
#Text=Talk about people behind their back .
#Text=Well , perhaps talk about their manners .
#Text=Discuss both good and bad mannered friends .
#Text=For example , talk about how your friend Dan always looks put together , has sparkling dinner conversation and always knows which fork to use for each course .
#Text=Quite the contrast , your friend Stephanie thinks that everything is a finger food and slurps her soda .
#Text=Take an etiquette class -- together ( or as a family ) .
#Text=For fun , ask him to join you ( and the kids ) for a manners and etiquette class .
#Text=Look for courses offered at your local community center or college .

#Text=A good etiquette class will not only cover table manners but may also hit on themes such as how to write a proper thank you card and how to dress for certain occasions ( topics that you may also want to cover ) .
#Text=Not only can a class be beneficial to getting him to stop his bad habits , bringing the kids along will help them cultivate good manners that will lead them into the future .
#Text=Practice proper table manners at home .
#Text=Lead by example and always practice proper table manners at home .
#Text=Also , if you have children , insist they practice table manners .
#Text=Use their errors as a way to point out “ do ’s ” and “ don’ts . ”
#Text=For example , if Mary is chewing with her mouth open while telling a story , stop her and say , “ Mary , a lady or gentleman never shows his or her guests the food being chewed .
#Text=Please chew with your mouth closed and then continue with your story . ”
#Text=Do n’t forget to deliver praise , especially if its your husband practicing good manners .
#Text=For example , “ Look at how well daddy remembered to place his napkin in his lap ! ”
#Text=Your husband will think you are just using him as a good example , while all along you are reinforcing good behavior .
#Text=Pick your battles .

#Text=Your husband may never know which fork to use for the salad course or whether he can get away with serving white wine with beef ; but as long as he can master the basics you should be able to dine in public with him and not want to hide .
#Text=Before a business dinner meeting , ask him if he wants to brush up on dining etiquette skills .
#Text=In effort to impress the boss , he may be more willing to take gentle advice on what he should be doing differently at the table .
#Text=Focus on one aspect at a time .

#Text=He may be a total disaster at the table , but instead of barking at him to take his elbows off the table , put his napkin in his lap and chew with his mouth closed , tackle it one bad manner at a time .
#Text=Do n’t allow table manners to ruin your marriage .
#Text=Sometimes the most stubborn of men may not adhere to change .
#Text=If he either does n’t understand what you want him to do or simply ca n’t remember do n’t turn it into a federal case .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Look for ways you can improve your own table manners ( we all ca n’t be perfect ) .
#Text=Let him know how much his transformation means to you and the impact it could have on his professional life as well .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=If you fighting about a different topic , do n’t use his bad table manners as weapon or a dig to hurt him .
